answers.answer: I havent received the results back yet they said they would either call me or wait for my next appointment so hopefully it is all okay.Im really sorry you have to take the 3 hour test so boring.

I thought I was going to fail mine for sure since I had a few chocolates before I went and did it (stupid, I know), but I actually passed - a miracle.I'm really sorry that you have to go through this.....Maybe try googling GD diets online and see if you can find something.  Good luck and keep us posted on how the 3 hour test goes! :-)

We had a work party the day before I took the test and all day long I ate cookies, cake, ... so I should not be surprised I "barely" failed. I googled GD diets online, but I did not find a specific diet. I found information such as "should keep sugar level constant throughout day". I know what that means, but not in terms of what I should eat to achieve this. Thanks for the good wishes. I'll post the results next week after the 3 hour test.

I failed the glucose test big time:( my doctor didnt even do the 3 hour test and sent me straight to endocronologist. I am on diet right now and seems that the diet is working for me so no need for pills or insulin. as far as the diet go, you have to basically limit the intake of carbohydrates(nothing with more that 15 g of carbs). which means more mean and protein, more vegetables and less cookies and rice, etc:(((i'll give you my sample diet, maybe this helps:Breakfast: one-two toasts with cheesesnack: crackers or cottage cheese or dannon light and fit fruit yogurt and a glass of milklunch: one starch(one toast, etc), meat and vegetablessnack: small fruit( shouldnt be eating a big apple)dinner: meat and vegetables and 5-6 tbsp riceI dont have a problem keeping up with my diet, but I really crave sweets sometimes.I hope your 3 hour test turns out fine.Lily

Thanks for sharing your diet Lily! 15 g of carbs sounds like so little. And I think I'm eating much more than you on your diet - at least in the afternoon and evening. I thought I was pretty good with sweets - I try not to keep them in the house. But I know it would be hard for me with the holidays coming up. I will try to modify my diet a little before the next test - and thereafter. Good luck keeping up with the diet Lily!

I just got my glucose test results back and I have to take the 3 hour test as well!  Wednesday I will take the 3 hour test!  My glucose level was 193 which the doctor said they do the 3 hour testing if the number is higher than 130!Docsaf,Good luck with your test!  I will be thinking about you and hope all is ok!
Found out today I passed the 1 hour with a reading of 114... Thank goodness!  Good luck ladies who have to do the 3 hour.  I hope everything turns out ok!
My results came back at 124 or 126 i dont remember so i barley passed. but i passed.

My first glucose test consisted of me drinking a small bottle of orange fizzy drink which they provided, I had to sit there for an hour and then have my blood taken. The results came back high. So then I had to it all over again but this time I had to fast for 12 - 14 hrs then get my blood taken, sit for an hour and then have my blood taken again and then drink that drink again... sit for another hour and then have blood taken for the last time. A total of three times in 2 hrs LOL. Anyway, my results came back that I didnt have gestational diabetes. From what I recall my numbers were under 100.

I took the 3 hour test this morning. I had to fast 12 hours before going in. I'm usually hungry as soon as I wake up in the morning, but it wasn't so bad at first. When I went in, they took a blood sample - baseline I guess? I drank a tall red sweet drink. And then every hour for the next 3 hours they took another vial of blood. No eating nor drinking during the 3 hours - that was the tough part. The last hour my stomach started grumbling and then right after I got home I started feeling light-headed. My 1 hour result was 134. I'm really hoping that I pass this time around. If not, I'll feel like the 3 hour test was a waste of time.  congratulations for those who passed! Good luck Melissa (and anyone else who failed) with the 3 hour test! For those who failed both, good luck sticking to the diet. And remember you're doing it for a healthy baby!
I passed the 3 hour glucose test!  Yeah!  Good luck to all of you and docsaf, Did you pass?
What do you ladies mean by pass your glucose test? Is there a range to shoot for before you can get pregnant or does it mean something else?
It is a test you take when you are approx 26-30 weeks pregnant to make sure you do not have pregnancy induced gestational diabetes.
I passed! I have cut down on the number of sweets I eat anyway, but I'm very happy to hear that I don't have to give them up over the holidays.
Thank you for explaining that. All of this is very confusing at times.

Unfortunately, the doctor called me and decided that since my first 1 hour test was so high that he wants me to test my glucose everyday to see how it is!  I passed the 3 hour and only missed 1 of the tests by just 1 point but he wants to be on the safe side!  Yuck!  Now I have to ***** my finger every day!  Oh Well better safe than sorry!docsaf, I am so happy for you!  That is wonderful!  Good luck in the rest of your pregnancy!

Sorry to hear that Melissa - it doesn't sound fair. If you passed the 3 hour test, it doesn't sound fair that you still have to test your glucose every day. Hopefully your results will be good and you will not have to modify your diet too much. As you said, better safe than sorry. Good luck!

question: Hello-I took the glucose screening test on Friday and failed. Next Tuesday I have to take the 3 hour, fasting glucose test and I'm not looking forward to it. Has anyone else failed the glucose screening test? If you failed both tests, where can I find a sample diet for those with gestational diabetes? I would like to change my diet before I take the test to see if that helps me pass. Any advice is greatly appreciated.Thanks,Shannon
title: anyone else fail the glucose test?
